Articles.Content:
With Zekes threatening to release a new Tiger II after seeing mine, I've decided to release it early. It's no fun to have my long term project go to waste (AP's and subject tests don't give me much play time.)

(He's probably going to release another version specifically made to overshadow mine... I'll get my revenge. )

I'll release a Tiger II-1 with a thicker frontal glacis soon.


https://www.dropbox.com/s/xiu9jwc4dcrt4cb/A%20Tiger-IIPIP-2_2%20Cockpit%20X.craft?dl=0

-NOTE: The turret must not be clipping into the hull while you decouple the turret, otherwise it will not work.

Add a cockpit and decoupler to the top if you want to have easier turret control. Also, wiggle a little if it gets stuck while rotating.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1mG3BvkT6YQ







Edited February 4, 2016 by andrew123
Great replica, although I think the real tiger 2 is almost TALLER :P

[quote name='Bubbadevlin']Great replica, although I think the real tiger 2 is almost TALLER :P[/QUOTE]

I based it off of a War Thunder picture, so it's not terribly accurate with dimensions. XD

As I said, I had to release this incomplete before Zekes zuckenberged me.

Ah, lolz yea if i personally make a replica, i use real pics, but i am sure the all-directions view of warthunder would make it alot easier to see the shape and such.

But for a WIP it is still really good :)

CommanderSpock and I both had B-17s, and we didn't have competition :P

This is awesome! I wanted to make one myself in KSP, but.. failed.
Looks a tad bit long but still was able to protect Berlin! Good ole Tiger II because ridiculous armor can stop those shells. Now if only I can find the spirit to build tanks again....
